channel.title: Git & Github on FEWD
channel.description: Recent content in Git & Github on FEWD

item.title: Objectives
item.description: Achieve high-level understanding of git and why developers use it Introduce students to a git workflow that will be used to submit (and recieve feeback on) assignments

item.title: Agenda
item.description: Tools Overview & Folder Organization Git Overview Code Along: Working with Github Exercise: Working with Github

item.title: Git Overview
item.description: What is Git? Version control for Programmers Like Microsoft Word “Track Changes” feature with superpowers Makes it easy for programmers to collaborate and work on the same codebase SVN (subversion) and CVS are other version control programs (Git is the most popular) What is Github? Web-based Git repository hosting service Built on top of git Home to +90% of all open source projects

item.title: Code Along: Working with Github
item.description: During this exercise, we will be walking through the process of working with Git and Github. The steps for submitting your assignments using Git & Github are detailed here Steps 1) Fork this US states repository located on Github.com 2) Clone the Repository using Github Desktop 3) Save the local copy of the repository in your FEWD/github folder 4) Open the project in Visual Studio Codeand fix the spelling errors found in index.

item.title: Exercise: Working with Github
item.description: Work together in pairs and follow the directions below. Use this Guide as reference Steps 1) Fork this repository located on Github.com 2) Clone the Repository using Github Desktop 3) Save the local copy of the repository in your FEWD/github folder 4) Open the project in Visual Studio Codeand and add the lyrics to Barney’s (you know the purple dinosaur) hit song “I Love You”. Save your work.
